H0.text: The A2 connects London to which other town or city. Canterbury

H1.text: The A2 connects London to which other town or city. Maidstone

H2.text: The A2 connects London to which other town or city. Gillingham

H3.text: The A2 connects London to which other town or city. DOVER

A4.text: The A2 connects London with the English Channel port of Dover in Kent.

A5.text: Straight after the interchange, Dunkirk and Boughton are bypassed as the A2 continues towards Canterbury and Dover.

A6.text: Dover's main communications artery, the A2 road replicates two former routes, connecting the town with Canterbury.

A7.text: The Roman road now known as Watling Street passes through Gillingham; and until the opening of the Medway Towns bypass (the M2 motorway) in the mid-1960s the same route was followed by the traffic on the A2 to Dover.
